page.title: 01PRESTWICH - INTRODUCTION
page.content:
There is no mention of{Prestwich}in the Domesday Book of 1086 but there is a record that in 1193 AD a Robert de Prestwich was fined for supporting Count John against Richard I
The name of{Prestwich}is taken from Preost-the old English for Priest- and Wyc meaning dwelling place.The name is known locally as "priests' retreat".
Prestwich has undergone considerable change over recent years.From being a village it has grown to a town having a population of 35,000 administered by {Bury Metropolitan Council.}It contains {Heaton Park,}the largest municipal park in the U.K. also the second largest{Jewish community}is resident in Prestwich and the immediate area.
